channel.title: Talks By Boyd K. Packer
channel.description: General Conference talks by Boyd K. Packer.

image.title: General Conference talks by Boyd K. Packer.

item.title: “The Spirit Beareth Record”
item.description: It was one year ago today, in a solemn assembly, that we had the privilege of raising our hands to sustain the authorities of the Church, much as we have done this morning. It was on that April morning that I heard my name read as one presented for y

item.title: The Only True and Living Church
item.description: It has been my privilege during the last thirty days to meet with missionaries and members in Great Britain, South America, South Africa, and here in North America. Always as we meet we find a common question that confronts us. Members of the Church,

item.title: Why Stay Morally Clean
item.description: Surely all of us have been conscious of the fact that there has been a very powerful spirit with us in this session this morning. Few times, I suppose, have I desired so much the sustaining power of the Spirit as I discuss a very delicate and difficu

item.title: The Saints Securely Dwell
item.description: After yesterday morning and this morning with President Lee, I think you can imagine the experience that is ours when we, as the Brethren, go to the temple, there to take sweet counsel together with him.

item.title: Behold Your Little Ones
item.description: Who has not been touched by the singing of these innocent children? I think of the account in Third Nephi, chapter 17, when the Lord commanded that the little ones should be brought. As they brought them they placed them upon the ground. He commanded

item.title: Inspiring Music—Worthy Thoughts
item.description: President Lee concluded our last conference in April with the statement that in his 32 years as a General Authority he had learned that the most inspired preaching is always accompanied by beautiful, inspired music. I am grateful this morning to be s

item.title: We Believe All That God Has Revealed
item.description: I have been inspired, as you have I am sure, by the words of our beloved President Romney as he opened the revelations to us this morning on the subject of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Where Much Is Given, Much Is Required
item.description: Today it is my hope to inform those who are not yet members of the Church, and at once to remind all of us who are members of the Church, of our responsibility to share the gospel.

item.title: An Appeal to Prospective Elders
item.description: I am conscious, my brethren and sisters, that concluding this meeting will be President Kimball. Prior to the meeting I told him that I had three talks of varying lengths prepared. During the singing I received a note from him asking that I use the l

item.title: The Redemption of the Dead
item.description: I have reason, my brother and sisters, to feel very deeply about the subject that I have chosen for today, and to feel more than the usual need for your sustaining prayers, because of its very sacred nature.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: I speak today to the youth of the Church, the Aaronic Priesthood and the young women, and these wonderful young people in our choir. In order to teach a lesson not easily learned, I will relate an experience.

item.title: The Mediator
item.description: What I shall say I could say much better if we were alone, just the two of us. It would be easier also if we had come to know one another, and had that kind of trust which makes it possible to talk of serious, even sacred things.

item.title: The Balm of Gilead
item.description: My message is an appeal to those who are worried or restless or anxious, a plea to those who are not at peace. If your life is touched with disappointment, grief, or bitterness; if you struggle constantly with worry, frustration, with shame or anxiet

item.title: Solving Emotional Problems in the Lord’s Own Way
item.description: Our bishops face increasing calls to counsel members with problems that have more to do with emotional needs than with the need for food or clothing or shelter.

item.title: The Relief Society
item.description: It will be my purpose to give an unqualified endorsement to an organization to which I have never belonged. It has greatly enriched my life and that of my family. I have never been eligible to hold membership; nevertheless, it continues to be an infl

item.title: “Judge Not According to the Appearance”
item.description: I speak to that member of the Church who struggles with a test of faith that could touch any one of us.

item.title: Prayers and Answers
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I pray for inspiration as I speak to young people about prayer, and about the things that happen afterwards.

item.title: A Tribute to the Rank and File of the Church
item.description: That day, 150 years ago, came and went quietly.

item.title: The Circle of Sisters
item.description: Just days ago Sister Packer and I attended Relief Society somewhere in Eastern Europe. There were in attendance twelve sisters. We sang the hymns of Zion from song books—words without music—printed nearly fifty years ago. The spiritual living lesson

item.title: The Choice
item.description: Following the April general conference a social was held for all of the General Authorities and their wives. The program centered on the opening of a jubilee box prepared by the Relief Society of the Box Elder Stake in Brigham City fifty years ago to

item.title: Marriage
item.description: The prophet Jacob foretold the destruction of a people because they were blind to ordinary things, “which blindness,” he said, “came by looking beyond the mark.” (.)

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: I always come to the Tabernacle early for priesthood meeting in order to shake hands with the deacons, teachers, and priests. I have to sift through a lot of elders, seventies, and high priests to find them, but it’s well worth it to meet the Aaronic

item.title: The Gospel—The Foundation for Our Career
item.description: There is a recurring theme in the revelations having to do with learning. And, from the beginning, Church leaders have counseled us to get all of the education we can as a preparation for and as an improvement of our careers. For example:

item.title: Scriptures
item.description: I must tell you of a work that has moved quietly forward in the Church virtually unnoticed. It had its beginning in Old Testament times and is the fulfillment of a prophecy by Ezekiel, who wrote:

item.title: Agency and Control
item.description: I have a message for parents about the education of your children. Several weeks ago I had in my office a four-star general and his wife; they were very impressive people. They admire the Church because of the conduct of our youth. The general’s wife

item.title: The Mystery of Life
item.description: I want to tell you of an incident that happened many years ago. Two of our sons, then little boys, were wrestling on the rug, and they had reached that line which separates laughter from tears. So I worked my foot carefully between them and lifted th

item.title: Feed My Sheep
item.description: I want to talk to my young friends of the Aaronic Priesthood. And I begin with a parable; and then I have a test for you.

item.title: The Pattern of Our Parentage
item.description: It is the Sabbath day, and outside is such a glorious day that all nature seems to bespeak the works of God. I can’t refrain from saying with the poet:

item.title: “From Such Turn Away”
item.description: Brethren and sisters, I had in mind speaking on another subject today.

item.title: The Only True Church
item.description: We believe that a man must [not could be, or might be, but must] be called of God, by prophecy, and by the laying on of hands by those in authority, to preach the Gospel and administer in the ordinances thereof.” (.) In this manner we receive our com

item.title: “The Things of My Soul”
item.description: I speak to those who have never read the Book of Mormon. This includes many members who have started to read it several times, but, for one reason or another, have never finished it.

item.title: Little Children
item.description: Some years ago, Dr. Faun Hunsaker, then president of the Southern States Mission, was invited to stay at the home of a member. He arrived after the children were in bed.

item.title: Covenants
item.description: I hope it is not presumptuous of me to place into the record of this conference, and therefore into the history of the Church, a note to complete the record of the last one.

item.title: Balm of Gilead
item.description: Some years ago, I spoke at this pulpit and entitled my talk “The Balm of Gilead.” The response was surprising. That very day two lawsuits were settled. One or both of the litigants decided that what they might gain materially was not worth the cost s

item.title: Atonement, Agency, Accountability
item.description: The Lord had come from Gethsemane; before Him was His crucifixion. At the moment of betrayal, Peter drew his sword against Malchus, a servant of the high priest. Jesus said:

item.title: Funerals—A Time for Reverence
item.description: Elder Scott, we welcome you to the quorum. Elder Richard Scott is a man in whom the Spirit is, and he is sustained by his lovely wife, Jeanene, who is not one whit less a spiritual power.

item.title: To Young Women and Men
item.description: President Monson has reminded us that this is a worldwide church. I once received a clipping from a newspaper in India reporting something I had said to young people at this pulpit. Among those who now listen, or who may later read what we say, are y

item.title: Revelation in a Changing World
item.description: Following baptism, one is confirmed a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in a brief ordinance, during which there is conferred the gift of the Holy Ghost. Thereafter, all through life, men, women, even little children receive t

item.title: The Library of the Lord
item.description: Brethren, it is an awesome responsibility to speak to you young men who hold the Aaronic, or the preparatory priesthood, and to you our brethren who hold the higher priesthood—the Melchizedek Priesthood, the Priesthood after the Holiest Order of God,

item.title: Covenants
item.description: It was an experience to hear President Joseph Fielding Smith pray. Even when he was past ninety he would pray that he would “keep his and and endure to the end.” The word is the subject of my message.

item.title: The Moving of the Water
item.description: “Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: A testimony of the gospel of Jesus Christ, a witness that the Book of Mormon is true, comes in a delicate, refined spiritual communication. It is described in the scriptures as light (), as burning in the bosom. It is best described as a (.)

item.title: Our Moral Environment
item.description: I have been a General Authority for over thirty years, and a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for twenty-two. During those years, I have interviewed I don’t know how many, surely thousands, of members of the Church and have talked with the

item.title: “To Be Learned Is Good If …”
item.description: I am grateful for the power of the choir, the power of music to introduce a spirit of reverence and worship.

item.title: The Temple, the Priesthood
item.description: Just before the dedication of the Salt Lake Temple, President Wilford Woodruff and his Counselors issued an epistle to the Saints. While a hundred years have passed, it might have been issued today. They said: “During the past eighteen months … polit

item.title: For Time and All Eternity
item.description: Dear brethren and sisters, the scriptures and the teachings of the Apostles and prophets speak of us in premortal life as sons and daughters, spirit children of God. Gender existed before, and did not begin at mortal birth.

item.title: The Father and the Family
item.description: A family begins when a young man and woman are drawn to one another by an irresistible force of nature. They offer to one another that which distinguishes him as male and her as female, and they want, above all else, to find the one with whom they ca

item.title: Personal Revelation: The Gift, the Test, and the Promise
item.description: When the funeral cortege traveled with the body of our beloved President Ezra Taft Benson to his final resting place at home in Idaho, every overpass was lined with people. There were along the way Scouts in uniform with flags. There were the elderly

item.title: “The Shield of Faith”
item.description: Ten months ago President Ezra Taft Benson passed away, and without a pause the brief and memorable administration of President Howard W. Hunter began. God bless the memory of this great prophet. Again, now, without the slightest pause, the order of t

item.title: The Brilliant Morning of Forgiveness
item.description: In April of 1847, Brigham Young led the first company of pioneers out of Winter Quarters. At that same time, sixteen hundred miles to the west the pathetic survivors of the Donner Party straggled down the slopes of the Sierra Nevada Mountains into th

item.title: The Word of Wisdom: The Principle and the Promises
item.description: These marvelous young people in this choir are typical of the young people that we meet all over the Church. How we love them. How grateful we are for you, our youth. is more precious than our children, our youth. And it is to you, our youth, that I

item.title: The Twelve Apostles
item.description: In the course of organizing His Church, Jesus “went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

item.title: Washed Clean
item.description: Imagine the consoling, liberating, exalting feeling that will come to you when you see the reality of the Atonement and the practical, everyday value of it to you individually.

item.title: Called to Serve
item.description: It is not in the proper spirit for us to decide where we will serve or where we will not. We serve where we are called.

item.title: The Relief Society
item.description: Sisters, you must graduate from thinking that you only attend Relief Society to feeling that you belong to it!

item.title: Parents in Zion
item.description: I do want to encourage leaders to carefully consider the home lest they issue calls or schedule activities which place an unnecessary burden on parents and families.

item.title: The Bishop and His Counselors
item.description: The Church is no bigger than a ward. … Everything needed for our redemption, save for the temple, is centered there—and temples now come ever closer to all of us.

item.title: The Spirit of Revelation
item.description: Young Latter-day Saints, shape up! Face up! Take hold of your lives! Take control of your mind, your thoughts!

item.title: The Cloven Tongues of Fire
item.description: In every language, the Spirit of God—the Holy Ghost—guides, or can guide, every member of the Church.

item.title: “Ye Are the Temple of God”
item.description: Your body really is the instrument of your mind and the foundation of your character.

item.title: “The Touch of the Master’s Hand”
item.description: We all make mistakes. … It is then in our nature to feel guilt and humiliation and suffering, which we alone cannot cure. That is when the healing power of the Atonement will help.

item.title: The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ
item.description: The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ has the nourishing power to heal starving spirits of the world.

item.title: Children
item.description: There is in what we believe, there is in what we teach, counsel, commandments, even warnings that we are to protect, to love, to care for, and to “teach [children] to walk in the ways of truth.”

item.title: The Stake Patriarch
item.description: The Lord has a special interest in the patriarch, who holds a unique position in the Church.

item.title: The Golden Years
item.description: Value the old folks for what they are, not just what they can do.

item.title: “The Standard of Truth Has Been Erected”
item.description: However out of step we may seem, however much the standards are belittled, however much others yield, we will not yield, we cannot yield.

item.title: Do Not Fear
item.description: The moral values upon which civilization itself must depend spiral downward at an ever-increasing pace. Nevertheless, I do not fear the future.

item.title: The Least of These
item.description: Let no one underestimate the power of faith in the ordinary Latter-day Saints.

item.title: The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ—Plain and Precious Things
item.description: The Book of Mormon is an endless treasure of wisdom and inspiration, of counsel and correction.

item.title: On Zion’s Hill
item.description: Every soul who willingly affiliates with The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and seeks to abide by its principles and ordinances is standing “on Zion’s hill.”

item.title: “I Will Remember Your Sins No More”
item.description: Through the Father’s redeeming plan, those who may stumble and fall “are not cast off forever.”

item.title: A Defense and a Refuge
item.description: We speak of the Church as our refuge, our defense. There is safety and protection in the Church.

item.title: The Spirit of the Tabernacle
item.description: The Tabernacle … stands as a standard of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Weak and the Simple of the Church
item.description: No member of the Church is esteemed by the Lord as more or less than any other.

item.title: The Twelve
item.description: For the Church to be His Church, there must be a Quorum of the Twelve who hold the keys.

item.title: The Test
item.description: Neither mobbings nor the army could turn the Saints aside from what they knew to be true.

item.title: Counsel to Young Men
item.description: The certainties of the gospel, the truth, once you understand it, will see you through these difficult times.

item.title: Prayer and Promptings
item.description: Experiences of prompting and prayer are not uncommon in the Church. They are part of the revelation our Heavenly Father has provided for us.

item.title: The Power of the Priesthood
item.description: The priesthood does not have the strength that it should have and will not have until the power of the priesthood is firmly fixed in the families.

item.title: Cleansing the Inner Vessel
item.description: Nowhere are the generosity and the kindness and mercy of God more manifest than in repentance.

item.title: Guided by the Holy Spirit
item.description: Every one of us can be guided by the spirit of revelation and the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Counsel to Youth
item.description: Despite the opposition, trials, and temptations, you need not fail or fear.

item.title: And a Little Child Shall Lead Them
item.description: Husbands and wives should understand that their first calling—from which they will never be released—is to one another and then to their children.

item.title: The Atonement
item.description: Wherever our members and missionaries may go, our message is one of faith and hope in the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: These Things I Know
item.description: Of all that I have read and taught and learned, the one most precious and sacred truth that I have to offer is my special witness of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Key to Spiritual Protection
item.description: Peace can be settled in the heart of each who turns to the scriptures and unlocks the promises of protection and redemption.

item.title: The Witness
item.description: Boyd K. Packer testifies of God the Father, Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost.

item.title: The Reason for Our Hope
item.description: Boyd K. Packer teaches that Jesus Christ and His Atonement are our source for hope, peace, and redemption.

item.title: The Plan of Happiness
item.description: Boyd K. Packer teaches about marriage, the power of procreation, repentance, and eternal families.
